text.name: console_notes
text.text: The Amstrad CPC (short for Colour Personal Computer) is a series of 8-bit home computers produced by Amstrad between 1984 and 1990. It was designed to compete in the mid-1980s home computer market dominated by the Commodore 64 and the Sinclair ZX Spectrum, where it successfully established itself primarily in the United Kingdom, France, Spain, and the German-speaking parts of Europe.

text.name: memory
text.text: Memory: 64 or 128 KB, expandable to 576 KB

text.name: media
text.text: Media: Cassette tape, 3 inch floppy disks
